executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on value stocks, small caps, international equities, healthcare (XBI), materials, Comstock Resources (CTO), Generac (GNRC), Boeing (BA), Etsy (ETSY), and Alibaba (BABA). He believes the market is in a regime change where value will outperform growth, and that the post-inauguration period will be ripe for a significant rally in these undervalued sectors. He is cautious on the Magnificent Seven, believing their earnings growth is decelerating and their multiples are too high. He emphasizes the importance of buying stocks with a margin of safety and a clear turnaround story.

macro_thesis_summary: The market is undergoing a regime change where value will outperform growth after a decade of growth dominance due to zero interest rate policies. The post-inauguration period will see yields compress and a rally in undervalued sectors. International and emerging markets are poised to outperform the US. A weaker labor market will keep the Fed in the game, supporting equities.
